description: Dive into "Capturing Coimbatore: A Photographic Journey" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capturing Coimbatore: A Photographic Journey

places.generalDescription: Sri Perur Pateeswarar Temple, located on the outskirts of Coimbatore, is a centuries-old Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Built in the 2nd century by Karikala Chola, it features a gold-plated Shiva statue and intricately carved stone pillars. Many believe it to be the site where Lord Shiva performed the divine dance of Ananda Thandavam.

sources.snippet: Perur Pateeswarar Temple | # 6 of the 15 Best Tourist places in Coimbatore. Perur Pateeswarar Temple is an ancient Hindu temple that traces its origin to the reign of King Karikala Chola. This centuries-old temple boasts of an eye-catching architecture in the Dravidian style and is quite popular among the devotees and tourists alike.
sources.shortName: 15 Tourist Places to Visit in Coimbatore 2024: Location, Timing

sources.snippet: It is quite an ancient temple which was built to worship Lord Pateeswara Swamy, commonly known as Lord Nataraja. The temple is situated at a distance of approximately 9 km from the main city and is largely known for its grand architecture, ancient artwork, paintings, sculptures, carvings, and relics.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Coimbatore, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: For those interested in cultural and architectural photography, the Perur Pateeswarar Temple is a must-visit. This ancient temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva, is renowned for its stunning Dravidian architecture and intricate carvings.
sources.shortName: Best Free Photoshoot Places in Coimbatore

places.name: Perur Patteeswarar Temple

reviews.text: This ancient temple holds a wealth of history within its sacred walls.  The intricate carvings and numerous statues are a testament to the artistry of a bygone era.  One can spend hours admiring the detailed craftsmanship and the stories they seem to tell.  Visiting this temple offers a glimpse into the rich cultural heritage of the region. The serene atmosphere provides a peaceful escape from the everyday hustle.  It's a place where one can reflect and connect with something larger than oneself. The beauty and tranquility of this temple are truly captivating.  A visit here is an unforgettable experience.

My visit to Perur Pattiwarar, one of the oldest and largest temples, was truly an enriching experience. This divine abode is heightened with the sense of tranquility and spiritual aura that it emits. Its intricate architecture leaves you in awe and wonder. The temple not only offers a peaceful sanctity but it also allows you to delve into self-reflection and achieve ultimate solace. It was indeed a very humbling and good experience.

Perur Patteeswarar Temple in Coimbatore is a must-visit for its divine atmosphere and stunning architecture. Built by the Cholas, the temple features a self-manifested Shiva Lingam, intricate stone carvings, majestic gopurams, and a gold-plated Nataraja in the Kanaka Sabha. The place is very peaceful, especially in the early mornings, and well maintained with good queue systems. General darshan is free, and special darshan is available for a small fee of ‚Çπ20. There's ample paid parking, nearby flower stalls, and clean surroundings. Located just 9 km from the city, it's easily accessible and perfect for both spiritual seekers and heritage lovers.

places.address: XWG7+8WV, Siruvani Main Rd, Perur, Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu 641010, India

places.generalDescription: Marudhamalai Murugan temple is a Hindu temple located on a hilltop at an elevation of 500 ft in the Western Ghats, about 15 km northwest of Coimbatore city. The temple offers an invigorating atmosphere and allows vehicles to pass through, with buses available for transportation to the top. Dedicated to Lord Muruga, it provides delightful facilities for visitors. Legend has it that the hill is a manifestation of Muruga and is surrounded by lush greenery.

sources.snippet: Marudhamalai Temple | # 11 of the 15 Best Tourist places in Coimbatore. Nestled in a lush green milieu on the Western Ghats, Marudhamalai Temple is one of the most popular religious destinations in Coimbatore. Built in the 12 th century, this hill temple is dedicated to Lord Murugan aka Subramanya and hence also known as Subramanya Swami Temple.
sources.shortName: 15 Tourist Places to Visit in Coimbatore 2024: Location, Timing

sources.snippet: The temple‚Äôs location amidst lush greenery and the panoramic views from the hilltop make it an ideal spot for landscape and sunset photography. The natural beauty of the place adds a serene vibe to your photos.
sources.shortName: Best Free Photoshoot Places in Coimbatore

places.name: Arulmigu Marudamalai Subramaniaswamy Temple

reviews.text:
A Peaceful and Stunning Experience at Marudhamalai Temple
Visited Marudhamalai Temple and found it to be an incredibly peaceful and divine place, perfect for both devotees and tourists. The entire premises were well maintained, clean, and neatly arranged-credit goes to the temple authorities and the support of local people.

We chose to walk up the steps to reach the temple, and although it was a long climb, the journey was worth every step. It became a beautiful experience, especially with my family.

The sightseeing and the artistic wall paintings inside the temple were truly stunning-absolutely captivating. The vibrant colors and cultural richness made our visit feel very special. It was a colorful and spiritually uplifting day that we'll always remember.

A divine and peaceful experience!
Maruthamalai Temple is truly one of the most beautiful and spiritually uplifting places I've visited. Located on a scenic hilltop, the views of Coimbatore city are breathtaking. The temple is clean, well-maintained, and surrounded by nature. You can either climb the steps or take the shuttle bus which is very convenient. Early morning visit is the best to avoid crowds and enjoy the calm atmosphere. Highly recommended for both devotees and nature lovers! üôè‚ú®

Maruthamalai Temple offers a peaceful and spiritually enriching experience. Nestled in the Western Ghats near Coimbatore, the temple is known for its scenic beauty, clean surroundings, and divine atmosphere. Whether climbing the steps or driving up, visitors are treated to panoramic views and a serene environment. The temple is well-maintained, the darshan is fulfilling, and the staff are helpful. It's a must-visit for devotees and nature lovers alike.

places.address: Maruthamalai Sri Subrahmanya Swamy Temple Rd, Marudhamalai Adivaram, Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu 641046, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the vibrant city of Coimbatore, Arulmigu Eachanari Vinayagar Temple stands as a testament to the rich spiritual heritage of Tamil Nadu. This stunning temple, dedicated to Lord Ganesha, boasts an intricately carved tower that showcases remarkable architectural craftsmanship dating back to the 16th century. As you wander through its serene surroundings, you'll be enveloped by a peaceful atmosphere that invites reflection and devotion.

sources.snippet: Eachanari Vinayagar Temple | # 10 of the 15 Best Tourist places in Coimbatore. The 16 th century Eachanari Vinayagar Temple draws scores of devotees and tourists to its premises every day, thanks to its splendid architecture and serene ambiance. Dedicated to Lord Ganesha, the temple stands as a major spiritual landmark of the area and is a must-visit destination for anyone visiting the city.
sources.shortName: 15 Tourist Places to Visit in Coimbatore 2024: Location, Timing

sources.snippet: This temple is dedicated to Hindu Lord Ganesha and attracts devotees from all over India, especially at the time of Ganesh Chaturthi, the Indian festival that celebrates the birth of Lord Ganesha every year. However, the invigorating Dravidian architecture of the Temple calls for a day‚Äôs visit for anyone who is travelling to Coimbatore.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Coimbatore, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: Within half an hour's drive from the city of Coimbatore stands the shrine of Vinayagar at Eachanari dedicated to Lord Ganesha. The temple follows typical Dravidian style architecture and is imbibed with a peaceful spiritual vibe around it. The story of the deity follows a myth that has been passed down from one generation to the next.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to visit in Coimbatore | Top Tourist Attractions

places.name: Arulmigu Eachanari Vinayagar Temple

reviews.text:
Echanari Temple is one of the greatest Vinayagar temples I have ever visited. The temple features a magnificent, large statue that radiates positive energy. It is well-maintained, with a clean and peaceful atmosphere.

There is a beautiful garden filled with lush green plants and flowers, creating a refreshing breeze-perfect for sitting and relaxing with family and kids. The entire place is filled with positive vibes. A must-visit temple when you're in Coimbatore!

Echanaari Vinayagar Temple in Coimbatore is a blessing.

We visited during our trip to Valparai and were fortunate to attend the 6:30 pm pooja. The idol of Vinayagar is impressive, and the aarthi was a treat to witness.

However, there was a bit of a rush, so if you're short on time or prefer less crowd, you might want to plan your visit accordingly.

The pooja items outside the temple were overpriced; a coconut, two bananas, and no flowers cost ‚Çπ120, which seemed steep.

Trustees to have temple own shop and provide reasonable price to devotees

The temple atmosphere was serene, and the prashadam, Sakarai Pongal, was delicious.

Parking was challenging due to the temple's location on the main road.

Despite the pricing concerns, we'd recommend visiting with family and friends. Coimbatore residents are indeed lucky to have this temple nearby.

Vinayagar Thunai! üôè

Visited this temple during our coimbatore visit, this temple was suggested by Anandas hotel manager.
The temple is located 12-15kms from coimbatore city.
The Vinayagar idol is about 6ft tall and looks magnificent. The entire temple gives you a Devine feeling. There is a small garden and a marriage area inside the temple.
Parking is available for 3 to 4 cars, there are shops to buy pooja items as well.
this temple is located under the flyover and has continuous vehicle movement.

This temple is special because many new bike or car buyers get their pooja done here.
Many devotees also perform dristi removal ritual with coconut here.
Nice place to add to your coimbatore list.

places.address: WXFJ+HWQ, Pollachi Main Rd, Eachanari, Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu 641021, India

places.generalDescription: Located on Avinashi Road, the Gedee Car Museum is a must-visit for car and bike enthusiasts in Coimbatore. The museum showcases an impressive collection of vintage and modern automobiles from countries like America, Britain, Japan, France, and Germany. Owned by GD Naidu, an esteemed industrialist with a passion for cars, the museum offers a fascinating display of well-maintained vehicles. Visitors can explore the history and innovation behind each car through informative displays accompanying the exhibits.

sources.snippet: Gedee Car Museum is one of the few places in India where one can find cars made in Britain, Japan, France, Germany and America under one roof. The collection of cars is extremely well maintained and all the relevant information about the cars on display is mentioned for visitors to learn. It is, therefore, a favourite attraction for automobile freaks and engineering students.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to visit in Coimbatore | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: G.D. Naidu was an eminent industrialist and philanthropist based out of Coimbatore. He had a passion for cars and his son founded the car museum in memory of his father. The museum aspires to teach young minds about the history of automobiles and serve as an inspiration to design better automobiles in the future.
sources.shortName: 11 Beautiful Places to Visit in Coimbatore

sources.snippet: For the better understanding of people, these cars are exhibited along with important information related to them. Each model has a sign board or chart that tells the whereabouts of the concerned car. Along with an impressive international collection, the Museum is also home to some antique Indian cars as well.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Coimbatore, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: GeDee Car Museum | # 5 of the 15 best Tourist places in Coimbatore. One of the most interesting places to visit for car freaks in Coimbatore is the GeDee Car Museum. This exemplary car museum resulted from the efforts of GD Naidu, a visionary and an industrialist.
sources.shortName: 15 Tourist Places to Visit in Coimbatore 2024: Location, Timing

places.name: Gedee Car Museum

reviews.text:
Just visited this amazing car and science museum! The car collection was incredible, spanning from colonial-era classics to modern marvels from the 2010s. Detailed descriptions for each model made it a treat for car enthusiasts.
The science museum was equally impressive, showcasing vintage household appliances that gave a fascinating glimpse into the past. A must-visit for kids (and kids-at-heart!) to appreciate how far we've come. What truly impressed me was the impeccable maintenance of the exhibits - everything looked pristine and well-preserved.
We spent around 1.5 hours exploring both exhibits and left feeling inspired and informed. Highly recommend!

The Gedee Car Museum in Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu, is a unique automotive museum that showcases a vast collection of vintage and classic cars. Here's a brief history 12) (3: Founding: The museum was founded by GD Gopal in 2015 as a tribute to his father, Gopalaswamy Doraiswamy Naidu (GD Naidu), a renowned inventor, industrialist, and philanthropist. GD Naidu's Legacy: GD Naidu was known as the "Edison of India" for his innovative spirit and contributions to various fields, including engineering, agriculture, and education. He started collecting unique cars during his lifetime, which formed the basis of the museum's collection.
Museum Collection: The Gedee Car Museum features over 100 vintage and classic cars, including iconic models from brands like Rolls-Royce, Ford, Mercedes-Benz, and more.
Some notable exhibits include the 1925 Rolls-Royce Phantom 1 and the 1936 Mercedes 170V. Purpose: The museum aims to educate visitors about the evolution of the automotive industry, showcasing technological advancements and engineering marvels. It'sa popular destination for car enthusiasts, history buffs, and families.
Location and Timings: The museum is located at 734, President Hall Building, Avinashi Road, Coimbatore, and is open from 9:00 AM to 6:30 PM, Tuesday to Sunday. Key Features:
Vintage Cars: The museum showcases a diverse collection of vintage cars from around the world, including Britain, Germany, Japan, France, Spain, and the United States.
Interactive Displays: While the museum primarily features static exhibits, some interactive elements and workshops may be available for visitors. Educational Value: The museum provides valuable insights into the history of the automotive industry, making it an excellent destinatioƒ± . for students and car enthusiasts.

Don't go with high expectations, as the exhibit features only a limited number of vintage cars on display. However, there are interactive models of car engines and gears where you can observe their working mechanisms, by shifting the gears yourself, which adds an educational and hands-on element. The entry ticket price is on the higher side, so it might not feel like great value for money if you're primarily interested in a vast collection of classic vehicles. Overall, it's a decent spot for enthusiasts who appreciate mechanical details and history.

places.address: 734, President Hall Building, Avinashi Rd, Race Course, Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu 641018, India

places.generalDescription: Located in Puliyakulam locality of Coimbatore, Tamilnadu, Sri Arulmigu Mundhi Vinayagar Temple is a prominent Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha. The temple was built in 1993 and is known for having the largest Ganesh idol in Asia, standing at 20 feet tall and 11 feet wide. It is considered a major attraction in the city due to this impressive stone-carved deity.

sources.snippet: The most important feature of the temple that makes is a major attraction in the city is the idol of Lord Ganesha which, at a height of 20 feet and width of 11 feet, is the largest idol of the deity carved in stone.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to visit in Coimbatore | Top Tourist Attractions

places.name: Sri Arulmigu Mundhi Vinayagar Temple - Coimbatore

reviews.text:
When I visited this temple, I couldn't stop myself from watching & getting mesmerized by the Gigantic idol of Lord Vinayagar (Ganesh). The idol is 20ft in height and carved out of single stone brought from Uthukuli town. The temple was built in 1982.
The idol is the largest Ganesha idol in India.
This temple is in the heart of Coimbatore city, ~1km from Lulu hypermarket in an area called Puliakulam.
The temple is right in the middle of the main road.
There is no dedicated parking here.
There are vacant spaces adjacent to many shops to park 4 or 2 wheeler.
This place definitely deserves much more recognition in Coimbatore traveller's list.
A must visit temple in Coimbatore.
One of the famous temple in Coimbatore. Huge god idol. Must visit place.

Holding the largest Vinayagar idol in the whole Asian Continent. The lord can be seen from the road itself. The temple is considered to be the centre for performing pooja to new vehicles. In aadhi moolavar sanidhi, lord Vinayagar is accompanied by Raghu and Kaedhu.

places.address: 2X3V+M6J, Pankaja Mills Rd, Ramasamy Nagar, Puliakulam, Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu 641045, India

places.generalDescription: Sree Ayyappan Temple, located in the heart of Coimbatore, is a popular attraction for both tourists and locals. Its magnificent architecture and historical significance make it a must-visit destination. Often referred to as the Second Sabarimala Temple, it bears resemblance to the famous temple in Kerala. The temple does not require entry tickets for regular darshan, with special darshan tickets available at a nominal cost.

sources.snippet: Sree Ayyappan Temple | # 14 of the 15 Best Tourist places in Coimbatore. Situated close to Coimbatore Railway Station, Sree Ayyappan Temple is a significant place to visit in Coimbatore. The temple has been built on the lines of the famous Sabarimala Temple in Kerala.
sources.shortName: 15 Tourist Places to Visit in Coimbatore 2024: Location, Timing

places.name: Sree Ayyappan Temple

reviews.text: Had a wonderful darshan here. This temple is so good managing to do all pooja as similar to Kerala Ayyappan temple. This is being owned by them. We could have a good feel while being here. This is walkable in distance from Gandhipuram bus stand. Must visit.

The temple and lord Ayyapa I
Having lot of power to do good things for you‚Ä¶ once if u enter into this temple definitely for sure good things will happen in rite time ..

The Pooja which they are doing is according to vedha so the power of each and every Pooja we can't say in words.
Visit to this temple and feel the vibrations

It's a mix of Guruvayoor and Sabarimala i felt ..

Whats a vibe place you feel the positivity all over and they tried all possible ways to make the place clean .. the outside as usual messy .

Coming from the entrance they have enough taps to clean the feet.

Kettunira they have a separate place with good number for guru swamys guidance and its overall it's best thing .

Overall it's the best place for peace of mind

places.address: 143, Chinnasamy Naidu Rd, Siddhapudur, New Siddhapudur, Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu 641044, India

places.generalDescription: The TNAU Botanical Garden, located in Coimbatore, is a serene and expansive campus featuring a wide variety of trees, flowers, and plants. Established in 1925 within the Tamil Nadu Agricultural University's premises, this botanical garden spans over 300 hectares of land. Visitors can explore the well-maintained grounds that include greenhouses, a nursery offering plants for sale, and an opportunity to learn about plant husbandry techniques.

sources.snippet: Coimbatore Botanical GardenThe Coimbatore Botanical Garden is a bustling place with a lake, lovely walkways, and a variety of plants. Couples looking for a blend of cultivated gardens and the great outdoors would love this location. Although the garden is easily accessible, early morning visits are advised because it can grow crowded on weekends.
sources.shortName: Best Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations in Coimbatore: Capture Your Love Story

sources.snippet: TNAU Botanical Gardens | # 4 of the 15 best Tourist places in Coimbatore. If you are a nature enthusiast, you will definitely love visiting the TNAU Botanical Garden. This huge garden is situated within the Tamil Nadu Agricultural University (TNAU) Campus and features an astounding variety of trees and plants.
sources.shortName: 15 Tourist Places to Visit in Coimbatore 2024: Location, Timing

sources.snippet: Spread over an area of around 300 acres in Coimbatore, TNAU Botanical Garden boasts of some rare varieties of trees, shrubs and herbs. The garden is very well-maintained and vibrantly blooms with flowers including roses, marigold, carnations, chrysanthemums, lilies etc.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to visit in Coimbatore | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Famed for its stunning collection of plants, colourful flowers, and lush lawns, the Botanical Garden is ideal for a serene and vibrant photoshoot. Read more about the garden: Exploring the Wonders of Nature at Coimbatore‚Äôs Botanical Garden.
sources.shortName: Top Outdoor Photoshoot Places in Coimbatore for Stunning Shots

sources.snippet: The TNAU Botanical Garden, with its vast array of flora, offers a colorful and vibrant setting. The beautifully maintained gardens provide numerous spots for capturing romantic and intimate moments.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Locations in Coimbatore for Stunning Memories

reviews.text:
Good spot for family and friends Dayout .
Photospots are more. Good Atmosphere and clean. Kid friendly. Children's park. Bird view and rabbits.

Entrance fees Rs.50 cash only.

The park looks greenGood place for a photoshoot and relaxing. Walking tails placed over the park.Trees with QR code provide information about trees. Children play area available. Cascade had no water. Drinking water and toilet facilities available

One of the most beautiful + worst maintained place in Kovai.  Some different species of worms / bugs starts to crawl on us, if we sit anywhere.  Zero cleaning.  There are so many natural plants / trees such that a minimal cleaning would encourage a lot of people to visit often, but not sure why it is not done.  Fortunately, we had some drinking water facilities available in few locations.
Hope this gets some better maintenance in the future.

Many clients have shared their delightful experiences, highlighting how Prakash creates a comfortable atmosphere right from the first meeting. His professionalism shines through on the big day as he captures every precious moment with an artistic flair that transforms fleeting instances into timeless memories. From weddings to naming ceremonies, Prakash Ray Photography excels in preserving those special occasions with stunning images that evoke deep emotions.

places.name: Prakash Ray Photography

reviews.text: We had an wonderful journey with Prakash Ray Photography from our wedding to our child's naming ceremony photography. They were very professional and captured all special moment. With each click of the shutter, they froze moments in time, preserving memories that would otherwise fade into oblivion. So here's to the photographers, the silent observers who gift us with glimpses of the world's wonders, reminding us to cherish each fleeting moment and find beauty in the smallest¬†of¬†details!!!!...  Special thanks to Prakash bro and his entire team... üôè

We had the pleasure of working with Prakash bro for our wedding, and we couldn't be happier with the results. From the very first meeting,  he made us feel comfortable and understood our vision perfectly. On the big day, Prakash bro was incredibly professional, capturing every special moment and the candid shots were amazing. The photos are absolutely stunning, beautifully edited, and capture the emotions of the day.  Highly recommend Prakash bro to anyone looking for a top-notch wedding photographer!

They were incredibly professional and accommodating. Prakash had a great eye for detail and captured some truly special moments. We're so thrilled with the results and will cherish these photos for years to come."

places.generalDescription: Nestled on the slopes of the Marudamalai hills, the Arulmigu Anuvavi Subramaniar Temple is a captivating destination just 27 kilometers from Coimbatore city center. This temple stands out not only for its spiritual significance but also for its breathtaking panoramic views of the Western Ghats. Visitors are drawn to this sacred site by its unique feature: a natural water flow that persists throughout the year, creating an enchanting atmosphere.

sources.snippet: What makes this pure Temple quite a tourist attraction is its miraculous yet natural way of outflowing the water all through the year. Additionally, there is a unique aura surrounding this Temple, which attracts a lot of people toward its grandness.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Coimbatore, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: The Anubhavi Subramaniar temple is one of the most famous temples situated in close proximity to Coimbatore. With a spiritual aura known for its uniqueness, this temple is visited by vacationers and locals alike.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to visit in Coimbatore | Top Tourist Attractions

places.name: Arulmigu Anuvavi Subramaniar Temple

reviews.text:
A peaceful hill top temple. Calm and quiet atmosphere. The climb is not that difficult.
There is plenty of parking space.
The temple timing is from 9 am but you can climb to the top before that.

The view from the top of temple is splendid. The architecture was stunning with intricate carving and peaceful atmosphere. It is a place where one can connect with nature, find peace. Temple is overall well maintained.

Near the parking down, there is also a giant Anganeya statue which dominates the landscape.

Very beautiful temple and surroundings and a very divine atmosphere.  We visited early around 7:30 Am and therefore it wasn't very crowded.  The climb of some 500 steps was not very difficult and the surroundings were green and teeming with bird life.  We spotted a peacock with peahen, some bee eaters and a rooster within the temple premises.

We also visited the saint's cave temple outside and also the giant hanuman and took photos of the whole place.

On the whole, a temple one must visit in Coimbatore.

The place which lifts up your mindset. So far it's clean because of less crowd. Treat your trash right. Be responsible with the environment and just co-exist with the birds and animals without creating disturbances.

places.address: 3R4X+RG4, Kanuvai, Coimbatore, Periya Thadagam, Tamil Nadu 641108, India

places.generalDescription: VOC Park and Zoo, also known as V.O.Chidambaranar Park, is a popular recreational destination in Coimbatore. It is frequented by locals for picnics and family outings. The park features a zoo with a variety of animals, including mammals, reptiles, and birds. Families can enjoy the children's play area, aquarium, and Jurassic Park section.

sources.snippet: VOC Park and Zoo | # 2 of the 15 best Tourist places in Coimbatore. When you take a count of tourist destinations in Coimbatore that holds an equal attraction for people of all age groups, the VOC Park and Zoo is on the top of the list. It is a nature park that features a zoo having 900 animals.
sources.shortName: 15 Tourist Places to Visit in Coimbatore 2024: Location, Timing

sources.snippet: One of the most popular places to see in Coimbatore, VOC Park and Zoo, also known as V.O Chidambaranar Park is an amusement spot and zoological garden. The park is visited by people who are into recreational activities and picnic purposes.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Coimbatore, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: VOC Park and Zoo are a favorite among locals and tourists alike. This park, named after the freedom fighter V.O. Chidambaram, is an excellent spot for family photoshoots, pre-wedding shoots, and nature photography.
sources.shortName: Best Free Photoshoot Places in Coimbatore

sources.snippet: For a more playful and adventurous shoot, VOC Park and Zoo offer a unique blend of natural beauty and fun activities. The lush greenery and variety of animals make for a lively and memorable photoshoot experience.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Locations in Coimbatore for Stunning Memories

places.name: VOC park and zoo

reviews.text:
V‚ÄØO‚ÄØChidambaranar Park and Zoo, popularly called VOC Park, is a compact zoological garden and amusement park in central Coimbatore, spanning about 4.5 acres  . Established in 1965, it was managed by the municipal corporation and once housed roughly 500‚Äì890 animals, including birds, mammals, and reptiles  . The park featured a children's play area, aquarium, toy‚Äëtrain, and a ‚ÄúJurassic‚Äù dinosaur-themed section set within landscaped gardens  .

It also hosted fairs, cultural events and public celebrations on Republic and Independence Day, and contained over 200 tree species, including sandalwood  .

However, the zoo's licence was cancelled by the Central Zoo Authority in January 2022, leading to its permanent closure and relocation of most animals to other state facilities. Plans are in progress to convert the premises into an aviary or bird‚Äëpark under municipal redevelopment efforts  .

There are few statues and monument present but they are maintained. Nothing to do in the park..

Would not recommend to bring kids here as there are no playing area.

The VOC park has been a top spot for kids earlier. The zoo is no more available but the parks are now well maintained than earlier. Also there are a few spots to take some good pics.. you can able to see many bats in the trees inside the park. Also the best thing now is ,the double decker bus is available for free for the next 2 weeks which starts in this VOC park.

places.address: 24, Park Gate Rd, ATT Colony, Gopalapuram, Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu 641018, India

places.generalDescription: Located in Coimbatore, India, Kari Motor Speedway is a rare racing circuit that offers an exhilarating atmosphere for motorsports enthusiasts. The track hosts national events and race practice sessions, making it a must-visit destination for those passionate about racing. The well-maintained facility provides an ideal backdrop for dynamic photoshoots and pre-wedding sessions, adding an exciting aspect to the experience. Visitors can enjoy the scenic surroundings and witness thrilling races while creating lasting memories.

sources.snippet: Kari Motor SpeedwayKari Motor Speedway‚Äôs exhilarating atmosphere makes it an ideal backdrop for daring couples. The raceway may add an exciting aspect to your pre-wedding session and is ideal for creating dynamic photos.
sources.shortName: Best Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations in Coimbatore: Capture Your Love Story

sources.snippet: Kari Motor Speedway offers a unique and thrilling location for prewedding photography. With its fast cars and adrenaline-pumping atmosphere, it is perfect for couples who love adventure.
sources.siteName: Wedding Photographers in Coimbatore Candid Photography Packages
sources.shortName: Top 10 Outdoor Prewedding Photoshoot Locations in Coimbatore

places.name: Kari Motor Speedway Racetrack

reviews.text: I had a fantastic experience at Kari Motor Speedway in Coimbatore. It was truly a memorable event, offering a thrill that left a lasting impression. Overall, an experience I'd highly recommend.

Just got back from an amazing 3 days at Kari Speedway Racetrack! The adrenaline rush from the high-speed laps was unbeatable! The track was impeccably maintained, and the staff was incredibly friendly and professional. Whether you're a seasoned racer or a curious newbie, this place has something for everyone. Can't wait to return!.

This is a well laid out and simple Race Track. Needs a bit of upgradation like better pit garages and proper construction. It's Near the Local vegetation so wild animals and birds like a peocock is a common spectacle on the racetrack which is lethal for anybody who is using the racetrack. The track also has a good vantage point called the Rolon Tower from where one can have a good look at the whole racing track. However, reaching back anywhere from here is a challenge it is located on the outskirts of the city and local commute to and from your accommodation is a challenging task.

places.address: Chettipalayam Rd, Chettipalayam, Tamil Nadu 641201, India
